com.mesosphere.mesos.rx.java.test.simulation

Class MesosServerSimulation<Event,Call>

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.mesosphere.mesos.rx.java.test.simulation.MesosServerSimulation<Event,Call>

  • public final class MesosServerSimulation<Event,Call>
extends Object
    MesosServerSimulation provides a server implementing the same protocol defined by Apache Mesos for its HTTP Scheduler API. The server has the following behavior:
    1. Run on a random port.
    2. Only one HTTP endpoint /api/v1/scheduler.
    3. Only supported method is POST.
    4. All requests sent to the server must specify Content-Length header.
    5. All messages sent to the server are interpreted as Calls.
    6. All messages sent from the server are Events.
    7. Authentication and Authorization are completely ignored.
    8. The events to be sent by the server are represented by the Observable passed to the constructor.
    9. Server only supports one event stream, once that stream is complete a new server will need to be created.

      Create a MesosServerSimulation that will use events as the event stream to return to a a client when isSubscribePredicate evaluates to true

    • Constructor Detail

      • MesosServerSimulation

        public MesosServerSimulation(@NotNull
                             @NotNull Observable<Event> events,
                             @NotNull
                             @NotNull MessageCodec<Event> sendCodec,
                             @NotNull
                             @NotNull MessageCodec<Call> receiveCodec,
                             @NotNull
                             @NotNull Predicate<Call> isSubscribePredicate)
        Create a MesosServerSimulation that will use events as the event stream to return to a a client when isSubscribePredicate evaluates to true

        The simulation server must be started using start() before requests can be serviced by the server.

        Parameters:
        events - The event stream to be returned by the server upon isSubscribePredicate evaluating to true For each Event sent to events, the event will be sent by the server.
        sendCodec - The MessageCodec to use to encode Events sent by the server
        receiveCodec - The MessageCodec to use to decode Calls received by the server
        isSubscribePredicate - The predicate used to determine if a Call is a "Subscribe" call

      • awaitSendingEvents

        public void awaitSendingEvents()
                        throws InterruptedException
        Convenience method that can be used to block a thread to wait for all events to be sent from the server.

        This method will block until onCompleted is invoked on the Observable passed to the constructor.

        Throws:
        InterruptedException - if the current thread is interrupted while waiting
        See Also:
        CountDownLatch.await()

      • awaitSendingEvents

        public boolean awaitSendingEvents(long timeout,
                                  TimeUnit unit)
                           throws InterruptedException
        Convenience method that can be used to block a thread to wait for all events to be sent from the server for a configured timeout.

        This method will block until onCompleted is invoked on the Observable passed to the constructor.

        Parameters:
        timeout - the maximum time to wait
        unit - the time unit of the timeout argument
        Returns:
        true if the count reached zero and false if the waiting time elapsed before the count reached zero
        Throws:
        InterruptedException - if the current thread is interrupted while waiting
        See Also:
        CountDownLatch.await(long, TimeUnit)
